title: Adjustments of Certain Rates of Pay

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates and sets the new rates of pay for various federal employees and officials, including those in statutory pay systems, the Senior Executive Service, members of Congress, federal judges, uniformed service members, and administrative law judges. The changes will take effect starting with the first pay period on or after January 1, 2024, superseding the prior pay adjustment order.
potential_concerns: The pay adjustments could lead to budgetary pressures that may affect funding allocation for veterans' healthcare programs, potentially impacting care quality for veterans.
Uniformed service members might face morale or retention issues if pay adjustments do not keep pace with cost-of-living increases or private sector compensation trends despite the raise.
Differences in locality-based comparability payments may cause pay disparities and dissatisfaction among federal employees working in different geographic areas.
Increasing salaries for political appointees and members of Congress could provoke public criticism regarding government spending priorities.
Implementation challenges in ensuring timely and accurate pay adjustments for diverse statutory pay systems might lead to payroll errors affecting federal employees' financial stability.
